meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of an oligarchy.
meanings.sent1: The oligarchic society favored the wealthy elite.
meanings.sent2: The country's oligarchic government made decisions for the few, not the many.
meanings.sent3: In the oligarchic book club, only a select few were allowed to choose the reading material.
meanings.sent4: Her oligarchic control over the office supplies made her the ruler of the stationery kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The oligarchic rule of the playground led to unfair games and unhappy children.

meanings.definition: Controlled by a small group of people.
meanings.sent1: The oligarchic board of directors made all the important choices.
meanings.sent2: Living in an oligarchic neighborhood meant following the strict rules set by a few residents.
meanings.sent3: The oligarchic pizza party planning committee always chose pineapple as a topping, much to everyone's dismay.
meanings.sent4: Her oligarchic influence over the team's strategy led them to victory after victory.
meanings.sent5: The oligarchic control of the school cafeteria resulted in limited menu options and long lines.
